title: 86/189/EEC: Commission Decision of 17 February 1986 concerning the establishments in the United States of America from which Member States may authorize the importation of fresh meat
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 17 February 1986
concerning the establishments in the United States of America from which Member States may authorize the importation of fresh meat
(86/189/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Member States may continue to authorize, until 31 December 1986, imports of fresh meat coming from establishments which have been officially proposed by the United States authorities, as of 21 January 1985, pursuant to Article 4 (3) of Directive 72/462/EEC, unless a decision is taken to the contrary, in accordance with Article 4 (1) of that Directive, before 1 January 1987.
The Commission shall forward the list of these establishments to the Member States.
This Decision shall apply from 1 June 1986.
This Decision shall be reviewed and, if necessary, amended before 1 January 1987.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 17 February 1986.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
